lang::Hashtable< K, T, F > Class Template Reference
[Language support library]

#include <Hashtable.h>

Inheritance diagram for lang::Hashtable< K, T, F >:

[legend]
List of all members.

Detailed Description

template<class K, class T, class F = Hash<K>>
class lang::Hashtable< K, T, F >

Hashtable maps keys to values.

Default hash function uses key hashCode() for hashing. Default compare function uses key operator==.

Parameters:
K Key type.
T Data type.
F Key hash function type.

 Returns iterator to the first element.

 Removes all keys from the container.

 Returns number of collisions occured in the hash table.

 Constructs an empty hash table with load factor of 75/100.

lang::Hashtable< K, T, F >::Hashtable (  int  initialcapacity,
float  loadfactor = 0.75f,
const T &  defaultvalue = T(),
const F &  hashfunc = F()
)  [explicit]
 

Constructs an empty hash table with specified initial capacity, load factor, default value and hash function.

Member Function Documentation

template<class K, class T, class F = Hash<K>>
HashtableIterator<K,T> lang::Hashtable< K, T, F >::begin (   )  const
 

Returns iterator to the first element.

Behaviour is undefined if the table is changed during the traversal.

template<class K, class T, class F = Hash<K>>
int lang::Hashtable< K, T, F >::collisions (   )  const
 

Returns number of collisions occured in the hash table.

Can be used for debugging hash functions.

template<class K, class T, class F = Hash<K>>
HashtableIterator<K,T> lang::Hashtable< K, T, F >::end (   )  const
 

Returns iterator to one beyond the last element.

Behaviour is undefined if the table is changed during the traversal.

template<class K, class T, class F = Hash<K>>
const T& lang::Hashtable< K, T, F >::get (  const K &  key  )  const
 

Returns the value of specified key.

Returns default value if the key is not in the table.

template<class K, class T, class F = Hash<K>>
HashtableIterator<K,T> lang::Hashtable< K, T, F >::getIterator (  const K &  key  )  const
 

Returns iterator to specified key.

Returns end() the key not in table.

template<class K, class T, class F = Hash<K>>
void lang::Hashtable< K, T, F >::merge (  const Hashtable< K, T, F > &  other  ) 
 

Merges two hash tables.

Note that some keys might be overriden if the keys are same in both sets.

template<class K, class T, class F = Hash<K>>
const T& lang::Hashtable< K, T, F >::operator[] (  const K &  key  )  const
 

Returns the value of specified key.

Puts the key to the map if not exist.

template<class K, class T, class F = Hash<K>>
T& lang::Hashtable< K, T, F >::operator[] (  const K &  key  ) 
 

Returns the value of specified key.

Puts the key to the map if not exist.

template<class K, class T, class F = Hash<K>>
void lang::Hashtable< K, T, F >::put (  const K &  key,
const T &  value
) 
 

Puts the value at specified key to the container.

If there is already old value with the same key it is overwritten.

template<class K, class T, class F = Hash<K>>
void lang::Hashtable< K, T, F >::remove (  const K &  key  ) 
 

Removes value at specified key.

Does nothing if the key is not in the table.
